overview_paragraph: Formerly the Academy for Environmental Leadership, we are a nurturing learning community that drives our students to excellence and teaches them how to be responsible leaders. We define a LEADER as Loving, Empowered, Altruistic, Driven, Enthusiastic, and a Role Model. Every student is a leader that is held to the highest standard and has constant opportunities for intellectual engagement. As we prepare our leaders for the world beyond high school, our students are empowered to take on leadership roles via partnerships with programs that focus on the arts, socio-emotional growth, career development and college readiness. Our instruction is student-centered, and students work with one another on relevant, real-world topics, using technology.
academicopportunities1: We conduct student-driven classrooms, where students collaborate with one another on authentic, real-world tasks using technology.
academicopportunities2: We offer AVID (Advancement via Individual Determination), a college readiness program that helps students develop skills to be successful in college.
academicopportunities3: As part of AVID, all of our classes focus on building skills in writing, inquiry, collaboration, organization and reading.
academicopportunities4: In their junior or senior year, students can earn credit teaching a class to ninth graders as Peer Leaders via Peer Group Connections (PGC) training.
academicopportunities5: Students can earn up to 18 college credits through Advanced Placement AND up to 12 college credits via College Now classes - a full year of credits.

school_name: EBC High School for Public Service - Bushwick
overview_paragraph: EBC High School for Public Service-Bushwick is a small school and we have a dress code. We focus on individual excellence, high academic standards and service to the community. We have an educational culture that instills respect, self-discipline, and strong intellectual values. At EBC, students are supported by our staff through an Advisory Program. Students, staff and parent(s)/guardian(s) thrive in a school that provides them access to college courses (on campus and off-campus), guitar and instrumental music. Students are college & career ready for life after high school because we nurture and empower our students to serve as tomorrow's leaders today!
academicopportunities1: AVID is a nationwide elective program for students who possess a desire for college and career success with a willingness to work hard. These are often the students who will be the first in their families to attend college and are from groups traditionally underrepresented in higher education
academicopportunities2: College Now offers college courses and supports high school participants in exploring academic and research interests, achieving success and building college competencies. The Medgar Evers College Pipeline is a program in Central Brooklyn that helps students going into college. Students are given dual credits in high school and college.
academicopportunities3: Inspiring Minds civics mentoring and internship program that helps students build a sense of self and leadership.
academicopportunities4: Public service learning projects in our Bushwick community.
academicopportunities5: Instrumental Music-Beginning, Intermediate and Advanced and Guitar curriculum. Hydroponics lab in science and working towards 1-1 laptop to student ratio.

school_name: Brooklyn School for Social Justice, The
overview_paragraph: At BSSJ, we develop a community of young leaders who will demand the best from themselves today and work together for a more just tomorrow. We are committed to providing a challenging curriculum that empowers students to succeed and to be active in the social, cultural, and political lives of their communities and their world. We are committed to ensuring that every student has constant and consistent opportunities for intellectual engagement and becomes confident in facing the pressing issues of the day. We believe that all young people have the right to equitable access to a variety of opportunities that they may not receive elsewhere. At BSSJ you matter!
academicopportunities1: A blended learning approach: Teacher use Google Classroom and other blended learning programs to expand online coursework, self-paced, project and inquiry-based learning opportunities. Chrome books are available for every classroom
academicopportunities2: Opportunities to earn college credits:CUNY College Now, Student Success Center offers electives through Brooklyn College, Medgar Evers Early College and Smart Scholars programs
academicopportunities3: College and career readiness: Advisory Leadership program provides guidance on health, SAT and ACT prep, and job readiness
academicopportunities4: Social Justice focus: Presentations at the citywide Social Justice Expo, partnership with Make the Road New York, Restorative Justice program, peer mediation, social justice circles

school_name: Academy of Urban Planning and Engineering, The
overview_paragraph: At AUPE, educators collaborate to center academic and social-emotional instruction directly around students. Our faculty is committed to rigorous and relevant curriculum and pedagogy that orients critical conversations towards building inquisitive and responsive learners. "95% of our Parents say that AUPE keeps their child on track for college, career, and success in life after high school." Incoming 9th graders are exposed early to Algebra Prep, Science Prep and Leadership Development during the summer prior to entering AUPE.  Our 9th graders are enrolled in African Drumming, Creative Engineering Courses, Online Learning through ALEKS Math and Google Classrooms, Urban Planning 101, Mentoring Programs, Gaming and Robotics.

overview_paragraph: We educate students from grades 6-12. All students wear a school uniform and participate in the Leadership Cadet Program. Our school culture is built on respecting others and our mission is to challenge the minds of our students each day both in and out of class. We expect our students to develop career goals and to cultivate the leadership traits and principles that are taught during the Leadership Cadet Program on Friday evenings.

overview_paragraph: Vision: Bushwick Leaders' High School for Academic Excellence will provide ninth through twelfth grade students with a quality secondary education, fostering active leaders with an emphasis on academics, college preparation and career readiness.
